intro: Elatostema brunneostriolatum, commonly known as the brown-striated elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant typically features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive brownish stripe running along the midrib. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in greenish-white or pale yellow hues. Elatostema brunneostriolatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
